author: chicks
title: decent frame with nice flexibility
review:
Building

It is pretty simple to build.  It is mostly white bricks with splashes of color in the detachable boxes that look like bricks.  A little care is needed to get the back pieces to line up.  The boxes on the side connect with Technic pins.  They used the grey pins so it is a bit easier to get them apart than it would have been with black pins.

Using

As a picture frame I think it works fine.  I put a postcard in it and it looks great.  It is not immediately obvious that it is made from LEGO's which I consider to be a bonus.  I would prefer for the back to be filled in, but that would have made it more expensive and it totally works as it is.

I haven't put anything in the boxes yet, but it should be useful for coins or paperclips.  The lids come off ok although I had the plate stay stuck to the lid once.

Modularity

Aside from the normal LEGO level of customization they've made it easy to do other things with your picture frame.  Since the boxes are easily detached with 2 or 3 Technic pins you can attach other things to your picture frame.  So far they've released the 40188 Pencil Pot which works with it.  I think the Pencil Pot works better by itself, but I also made a business card holder that snaps onto either side.

Parts

Lots of bricks and plates in only four colors.  I'm happy I made one, but it might be worth parting a few out.
